trans-unit.source: Returns a handle that can be passed to TimerDiff() to calculate the difference in milliseconds.

seg-source.mrk: Returns a handle that can be passed to TimerDiff() to calculate the difference in milliseconds.

target.mrk: Returns a handle that can be passed to TimerDiff() to calculate the difference in milliseconds.

trans-unit.source: Returns a handle that can be passed to TimerDiff() to calculate the difference in milliseconds.

seg-source.mrk: Returns a handle that can be passed to TimerDiff() to calculate the difference in milliseconds.

target.mrk: Returns a handle that can be passed to TimerDiff() to calculate the difference in milliseconds.

trans-unit.source: The return value from TimerInit() should be treated as an opaque handle and should only be used to pass to TimerDiff(). Any other usage of the return value is a potential error.

seg-source.mrk: The return value from TimerInit() should be treated as an opaque handle and should only be used to pass to TimerDiff().
Any other usage of the return value is a potential error.

target.mrk: The return value from TimerInit() should be treated as an opaque handle and should only be used to pass to TimerDiff().
Any other usage of the return value is a potential error.

trans-unit.source: Begin the timer and store the handle in a variable.

seg-source.mrk: Begin the timer and store the handle in a variable.

target.mrk: Begin the timer and store the handle in a variable.

trans-unit.source: Find the difference in time from the previous call of TimerInit. The variable we stored the TimerInit handlem is passed as the "handle" to TimerDiff.

seg-source.mrk: Find the difference in time from the previous call of TimerInit.
The variable we stored the TimerInit handlem is passed as the "handle" to TimerDiff.

target.mrk: Find the difference in time from the previous call of TimerInit.
The variable we stored the TimerInit handlem is passed as the "handle" to TimerDiff.
